p: Further inspections of the above BlastP output provided an exciting guess as to the putative target of the above ADPR enzyme. All the top matches of the nsp3 putative ADPR-binding site corresponded to that of various isoforms of the PARP14 protein ( Figure 3). It turns out that this protein plays a significant role in the regulation of the inflammatory response that is out of control in severe cases of COVID-19.
